name: wl-luk-pm2.21

body.origin:
|- wi(wn(w0), wi(w0, w1))
-| wi(w0, wi(wn(w0), w1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wn(w0), wi(w0, w1))
-| wi(w0, wi(wn(w0), w1))

comment: From a wff and its negation, anything follows. Theorem *2.21 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 104. Also called the Duns Scotus law. Copy of ~ pm2.21 with a different proof. (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 17-Dec-2018.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
